thread.title: UAlbany men's basketball picked 2nd, women 1st in poll
thread.title_full: UAlbany men's basketball picked 2nd, women 1st in poll - Times Union

author: Tim Wilkin
title: UAlbany men's basketball picked 2nd, women 1st in poll
text:
Photo: Tim Roske Image 1 of / 2 2 Albany coach Will Brown holds up the net after Albany's 51-50 win over Stony Brook in an NCAA college basketball game in the America East Conference tournament championship in Albany, N.Y., on Saturday, March 14, 2015. (AP Photo/Tim Roske) ORG XMIT: NYTR107 Albany coach Will Brown holds up the net after Albany's 51-50 win over Stony Brook in an NCAA college basketball game in the America East Conference tournament championship in Albany, N.Y., on Saturday, March ... more Image 2 of 2 Buy photo UAlbany basketball coach Will Brown talks about his team during an interview in his office on the UAlbany campus on Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015, in Albany, N.Y. The three-time defending America East Tournament champions will begin practice on Thursday. (Paul Buckowski / Times Union) UAlbany basketball coach Will Brown talks about his team during an interview in his office on the UAlbany campus on Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015, in Albany, N.Y. The three-time defending America East Tournament ... more Buy this photo UAlbany men's basketball picked 2nd, women 1st in poll 1 / 2 Back to Gallery Albany
At first, University at Albany men's basketball coach Will Brown said the annual preseason coaches' poll put out by the America East doesn't mean anything.
Then he changed his mind.
UAlbany was predicted to finish second in the nine-team league. The top spot went to Stony Brook, which gobbled up seven of the first-place votes; the Great Danes got the other two. Coaches are not allowed to vote for their own team.
The Danes didn't practice Thursday, but the next time Brown is with his team, he'll talk about the poll.
"I will absolutely tell them about it," he said. "We are the three-time defending champions in the league. I want to make it clear to them the coaches think there is a team in the league better than us. According to the experts, Stony Brook is the team to beat. You know us coaches; we are all crazy. We try to find different ways to get through to kids."
More Information
America East forecasts
(First-place votes in parentheses; also total points)
Men's poll
1. Stony Brook (7) 63
2. UAlbany (2) 55
3. Vermont 49
4. New Hampshire 47
5. Binghamton 32
6. Hartford 24
7. UMBC 23
8. UMass-Lowell 19
9. Maine 12
Women's poll
1. UAlbany (6) 62
2. Maine (2) 58
3. New Hampshire (1) 44
5. Hartford 39
6. UMBC 34
7. UMass-Lowell 18
8. Vermont 15
9. Binghamton 14
UAlbany won the America East regular season last year, finishing 15-1, then won its third straight conference tournament, earning an NCAA Tournament spot. The Danes beat Stony Brook 51-50 in the championship game at SEFCU Arena.
UAlbany is the only team with two players on the preseason all-conference team. Senior guards Peter Hooley and Evan Singletary were chosen along with Stony Brook's Jameel Warney (the America East Player of the Year the past two seasons), Vermont's Ethan O'Day and New Hampshire's Tanner Leissner.
The UAlbany women, the four-time defending America East champs, were picked to finish first in the league. The Danes picked up six of the first-place votes while Maine got a pair and New Hampshire got the other. UAlbany was 14-2 in the league last year and had the same overall record as the men, 24-9.
UAlbany also placed two players on the preseason all-conference team. Senior Shereesha Richards, the league's Player of the Year the past two seasons, was selected, as was junior Imani Tate , the league's Sixth Player of the Year last season. Joining them are Maine's Sigi Koizar and Liz Wood as well as Elizabeth Belanger of New Hampshire.
